content: अभिधा {c3c} <ab>U.</ab> {@--1@} ({%a%}) To say, speak, tell (with <ab>acc.</ab>, rarely with <ab>dat.</ab>); सा तथ्यमेवाभिहिता भवेन <ls>Ku. 3. 63</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 42</ls>; <ls>Bk. 7. 78</ls>; <ls>Bg. 18. 68.</ls> ({%b%}) To denote, express or convey directly or primarily (as sense &c.); state, mention, set forth; साक्षात्संकेतितं योर्थमभिधत्ते स वाचकः <ls>K. P. 2</ls>; तन्नाम येनाभिदधाति सत्त्वं. ({%c%}) To speak or say to, address. {@--2@} To name, call, designate; usually in {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} (--धीयते); इदं शरीरं कौंतेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते <ls>Bg. 13. 1.</ls> {@--3@} To lay or put on, fasten, bind; to overlay, load; assail; receive, comprehend, include; to draw oneself towards, hold, support (mostly <ab>Ved.</ab> in these senses).

अभिधा {%<ab>a.</ab>%} <ab>Ved.</ab> Naming; praised, invoked. --धा {@--1@} A name, appellation; <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab>; कुसुमवसंताद्यभिधः <ls>S. D.</ls> {@--2@} A word, sound. {@--3@} The literal power or sense of a word, {%denotation%}, one of the three powers of a word; वाच्योर्थोऽभिधया बोध्यः <ls>S. D. 2</ls> ‘the expressed meaning is that which is conveyed to the understanding by the word's denotation’, for it is this अभिधा that conveys to the understanding the meaning which belongs to the word by common consent or convention (संकेत) (which primarily made it a word at all); स मुख्योऽर्थस्तत्र मुख्यो यो व्यापारोऽस्याभिधोच्यते <ls>K. P. 2.</ls>
